snippet: The Supreme Court has acted in a lesbian couple’s adoption dispute, siding with an adoptive mother after the Alabama Supreme Court refused to recognize her adoptions of three children.
abstract: Supreme Court blocks Alabama judicial ruling that refused to recognize lesbian mother's parental rights over three children she adopted with her former lesbian partner, who is birth mother; decision restores her visitation rights, while justices consider whether to hear case.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has acted in a lesbian couple’s adoption dispute, siding with an adoptive mother after the Alabama Supreme Court refused to recognize her adoptions of three children.

headline.main: Justices Favor Lesbian Adoptive Mother in Visitation Case
headline.print_headline: Justices Say Lesbian Mother May Visit Adopted Children
